title: Samsung Galaxy Tab Lite (SM-T110) Root
description:
By Soulofall

How to Root Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 Lite WiFi SM-T110

Step 1: Extract the Odin zip file and run it.

Step 2: Turn Off your tablet and Reboot it into Download Mode, Hold down the Ã¢â‚¬ËœHome+Volume Down+PowerÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ buttons at the same time and release it when you see a warning message on your screen. Further hit the Ã¢â‚¬ËœVolume UpÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ to continue.

Step 3: Connect your Galaxy Tab 3 to PC via the USB data cable. Make sure that Odin detects your device.

Step 4: In Odin3 make sure that you only check the Ã¢â‚¬ËœF. Reset TimeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢:

Installing Recovery using Odin v3.09

Step 5: Hit the AP button in Odin and Select the 'T110.CWM.v6.0.4.8.tar.md5' file.

Step 6: Wait for Odin to analyze the files and once done, hit the START button to start flashing CWM recovery on Galaxy Tab 3 Lite.

Step 7: Once done, Odin3 will notify you and youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll notice the Ã¢â‚¬Å“RES OKÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ in message section.

Step 8: Now Reboot your phone by Pressing and Holding the Ã¢â‚¬ËœVolume Down+Home+PowerÃ¢â‚¬Ëœ buttons simultaneously. Repeating Steps 2 - 4

Step 9: Hit the AP button in Odin and Select the 'philz_touch_6.30.1-goyawifi.tar.md5' file.

Step 9: Now Reboot your phone into Custom Recovery by Pressing and Holding the Ã¢â‚¬ËœVolume Up+Home+PowerÃ¢â‚¬Ëœ buttons simultaneously.

Step 10: Copy the android-armeabi-universal-root-signed.zip file to your sd card. Insert the SD Card.

Step 3: In the Recovery Menu, Select Install Zip from SD Card and navigate to Storage Directory and select root zip package files youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve recently transferred to your tablet.

Step 4: Once flushed successfully, head back to the main menu, and Reboot your phone using the option Ã¢â‚¬ËœReboot your system nowÃ¢â‚¬â„¢.

Step 5: Once rebooted normally, Check that SuperSU has been installed.
